ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cxx_compiler:
- gxx
cxx_compiler_version:
- '14'
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
krb5:
- '1.21'
libcurl:
- '8'
libuuid:
- '2'
libxml2_devel:
- '2.14'
ncurses:
- '6'
openssl:
- '3.5'
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
readline:
- '8'
target_platform:
- linux-64
zip_keys:
- - c_compiler_version
  - cxx_compiler_version
zlib:
- '1'

about.description:
The XROOTD project aims at giving high performance, scalable fault tolerant
access to data repositories of many kinds. The typical usage is to give
access to file-based ones. It is based on a scalable architecture, a
communication protocol, and a set of plugins and tools based on those. The
freedom to configure it and to make it scale (for size and performance)
allows the deployment of data access clusters of virtually any size, which
can include sophisticated features, like authentication/authorization,
integrations with other systems, WAN data distribution, etc.
about.summary: High performance, scalable fault tolerant access to data

raw_meta_yaml:
schema_version: 1

context:
  name: xrootd
  version: "5.9.0"

package:
  name: ${{ name|lower }}
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/xrootd/xrootd/archive/v${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 39eed9976f141e869eba721f41f61a3dadae15b17a49d6432725df2e45ef6d5f

build:
  number: 0
  skip: win

requirements:
  build:
    - if: build_platform != target_platform
      then:
        - python
        - cross-python_${{ target_platform }}
        - setuptools
        - pip
    - ${{ compiler('c') }}
    - ${{ compiler('cxx') }}
    - ${{ stdlib("c") }}
    - cmake
    - make
    - pkg-config
  host:
    - openssl
    - python
    - setuptools
    - pip
    - readline
    - libxml2-devel
    - if: not osx
      then: libuuid
    - libcurl
    - krb5
    - zlib
    - ncurses
    - scitokens-cpp
    - libxcrypt
  run:
    - openssl
    - python
    - readline
    - libxml2-devel
    - krb5
    - zlib
    - ncurses
  run_exports:
    - ${{ pin_subpackage('xrootd', upper_bound='x') }}

tests:
  - python:
      imports:
        - XRootD.client
        - pyxrootd

about:
  license: LGPL-3.0-or-later
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: High performance, scalable fault tolerant access to data
  description: |
    The XROOTD project aims at giving high performance, scalable fault tolerant
    access to data repositories of many kinds. The typical usage is to give
    access to file-based ones. It is based on a scalable architecture, a
    communication protocol, and a set of plugins and tools based on those. The
    freedom to configure it and to make it scale (for size and performance)
    allows the deployment of data access clusters of virtually any size, which
    can include sophisticated features, like authentication/authorization,
    integrations with other systems, WAN data distribution, etc.
  homepage: http://xrootd.org/
  repository: https://github.com/xrootd/xrootd

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - chrisburr
